info.game_comments:
2005 College Championship final game 2.
From the RBC Center in Raleigh, North Carolina.

(1, 1).clue: In 324 B.C. he was king of Persia & leader of Greece, as well as king of Macedonia

(2, 1).clue: The Davey O'Brien Award goes to the top player at this position; Peyton Manning & Eric Crouch are recent winners

(3, 1).clue: At Madison's request, Congress declared war on the U.K. on June 18 of this year

(4, 1).clue: Eaten for breakfast or as a side dish, hominy grits are made from this

(5, 1).clue: A newborn gnu is called one of these, like an elephant or a whale

(6, 1).clue: Any pigment on the wall so faded you can barely see it

(1, 2).clue: Personal difficulties led him to resign as Secretary of the Treasury in 1795

(2, 2).clue: In January 2005 this Heisman-winning Trojan announced he'd return for a final year

(3, 2).clue: Completed in 1825, this New York waterway cost more than $7 million to build

(4, 2).clue: Developed in Louisiana, praline is a sweet traditionally made with brown sugar & these nuts

(6, 2).clue: A manly tortilla chip smothered with melted cheese

(1, 3).clue: Helen Keller's parents chose Anne Sullivan as her teacher on the advice of this inventor

(2, 3).clue: This Provo, Utah school won 10 straight WAC football titles from 1976 to 1985

(3, 3).clue: Denmark Vesey, brought to Charleston in 1783, planned one of the USA's first of these types of revolt in 1822

(5, 3).clue: Young people should know this 3-letter name for a young ruminant

(5, 4).clue: It can mean a young equine, or be a verb meaning to give birth to one

(6, 4).clue: Accept the loan of someone else's pain & sadness

(1, 5).clue: Georgia is represented in Washington D.C.'s Statuary Hall by this Confederate vice president

(3, 5).clue: Controversial "bank" led by Nicholas Biddle from 1823 to 1836
(3, 5).correct response: the Bank of the United States

(5, 5).clue: In "Songs of Innocence", William Blake asked it, "Who made thee?"

(2, 1).clue: This group uses "Blood Sugar Sex Magik" & cowbell when "Breaking The Girl""Twisting and turning you're feeling the burning you're breaking the girl..."

(3, 1).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew points to some expressions on a monitor.)  In a complex number of the form shown here, "i" is short for this type of unreal number, like the square root of negative one

(4, 1).clue: It was followed by the Iron Age

(5, 1).clue: We meet her tantalizing the Tarleton Twins at Tara

(6, 1).clue: Numerically, it's the next word in the sequence ein, zwei...

(2, 2).clue: "That Don't Impress Me Much" that this country diva uses cowbell

(3, 3).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a triangle on a monitor.)  With respect to angle ABC, the sides of the right triangle are commonly called hypotenuse, opposite & this
